## Introduction

This report analyzes the built-in `iris` dataset using pure functions defined in `functions/R/clean_and_summarize.R`.  
The analysis covers cleaning, summarizing, and visualizing measurements by species.

## Load and Clean Data

```{r}
#| label: load-and-clean
library(tidyverse)
source("../functions/R/clean_and_summarize.R")

data(iris)

# Clean and filter
cleaned_iris <- clean_iris(iris)
```

## Summary Statistics by Species

```{r}
#| label: summary-table
summarized <- summarize_by_species(cleaned_iris)
summarized
```

## Visualization

```{r}
#| label: boxplots
#| fig-width: 10
#| fig-height: 6
plot_iris_boxplots(cleaned_iris)
```

## Conclusion
The boxplots show clear differences in petal and sepal dimensions across species, especially Iris setosa being distinct in petal length/width.
This report is fully reproducible thanks to Nix environment and pure functions.
